main event: On June 15, 1955, a brilliant green object, resembling the size of a grapefruit at arm's length, was observed in Minneapolis, Minnesota and Topeka, Kansas. It displayed an unusual behavior of snapping to a stop, hovering, and then suddenly accelerating and disappearing. Small pieces seemed to have fallen from the main body of the object.
interesting points: The object displayed a brilliant green color, turning to red, and had a tail behind it, resembling the size and appearance of those on the moon.
It was observed for about 1 minute before accelerating and disappearing suddenly.
A similar sighting occurred at Topeka, Kansas a few minutes later, displaying the same characteristics.
Both sightings were evaluated as possibly astronomical with no further investigation.
The observations were made by credible sources such as a military pilot and a weather jet pilot.
sighted object: brilliant green object resembling the size of a grapefruit at arm's length
